summary: This document is an email or memo summarizing a call on December 7, 2021, between individuals from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) and a FedEx representative, Tracy Chapell. The discussion covered logistics for upcoming testimony, billing records, a pseudonym order, and FedEx's billing systems.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.context: FedEx representative who was COVID tested (negative) and discussed with the U.S. Attorney's Office the generation of billing records and systems for an upcoming testimony.

persons.name: Melissa Gormly
persons.context: Participant in the call who discussed upcoming testimony, billing records, and the pseudonym order with Tracy Chapell from FedEx.

connections.description: Communicated in a call to discuss logistics for upcoming testimony, billing records, and a pseudonym order related to the case.

events.title: Call with FedEx Representative
events.description: A call took place between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and Tracy Chapell from FedEx to discuss upcoming testimony, billing records, a pseudonym order, and FedEx's billing systems.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of NewNY (USAO SDNY) was preparing for upcoming testimony involving FedEx records.
FedEx billing records were generated through a system called 'IBM on Demand' (now RDA) and could be paper billed or electronically charged.
A pseudonym order was discussed, indicating measures to protect identities in the legal proceedings.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
